data.enText: a false spoken statement intended to damage the good opinion people have of sb; the legal offence of making this kind of statement

data.chText: 对那家公司良好声誉的恶意诽谤
data.enText: a vicious slander on the company's good name
to make a false spoken statement about sb that is intended to damage the good opinion that people have of them

data.chText: 他气愤地指责调查者诋毁他和他的家人。
data.enText: He angrily accused the investigators of slandering both him and his family.

tr: an abusive attack on a person's character or good name
words falsely spoken that damage the reputation of another
charge falsely or with malicious intent
attack the good name and reputation of someone
example: The journalists have defamed me!" "The article in the paper sullied my reputation

value.def: Slander is an untrue spoken statement about someone which is intended to damage their reputation.

example.ex: Dr. Bach is now suing the company for slander...
example.tran: 巴赫博士目前正以诽谤罪起诉该公司。

example.ex: Korea has been a target of threats and slanders from the major western powers.
example.tran: 朝鲜一直是西方主要大国威胁和诋毁的目标。

value.def: To slander someone means to say untrue things about them in order to damage their reputation.

example.ex: He has been questioned on suspicion of slandering the Prime Minister.
example.tran: 他由于涉嫌诽谤首相而受到了盘问。
